1.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
1.str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.

1.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
1.str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
1.str2: To howl, lament loudly, cry aloud, bewail. A reduplicated primary verb; to 'howl' or 'halloo', i.e. Shriek.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Hardship, misery, distress, toil. From talaiporos; wretchedness, i.e. Calamity.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Feminine Plural
1.str2: From epi and erchomai; to supervene, i.e. Arrive, occur, impend, attack, influence.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
1.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From the base of pletho; wealth, i.e. money, possessions, or abundance, richness, valuable bestowment.

2.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: To cause to rot, make corrupt. Apparently a primary verb; to putrefy, i.e. perish.
Moth-eaten. From ses and a derivative of bibrosko; moth-eaten.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Perhaps from the base of chraomai; gold; by extension, a golden article, as an ornament or coin.
And, even, also, namely.
Silver as a metal. From argos; silver.

3.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: To rust; pass: To be rusted, tarnished. From kata and a derivative of ios; to rust down, i.e. Corrode.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
3.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Poison, rust; an arrow. Perhaps from eimi or hiemi; rust; also venom.

3.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular

Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.

3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

3.str2: A primary verb; to eat.

Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
3.str2: To store up, treasure up, save, lay up. From thesauros; to amass or reserve.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

16.str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.
Supplication, prayer, entreaty. From deomai; a petition.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.

16.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Feminine Singular
16.str2: From energes; to be active, efficient.

16.str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.

17.str2: Elijah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Helias, an Israelite.

17.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
17.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
From homoios and the alternate of pascho; similarly affected.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
17.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
To moisten, rain, send rain. A primary verb; to moisten.

On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A year, cycle of time. Prolongation from a primary enos; a year.

Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

18.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Rain. From a primary huo; rain, especially a shower.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

18.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: Intrans: I sprout; trans: I cause to sprout, make to grow up. From blastos; to germinate; by implication, to yield fruit.

Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

19.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

19.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

19.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
